message_1: Suppose there are 10 people at a party. Each person can shake hands with every other person only once. How many handshakes will there be?
message_2:
To find the total number of handshakes, we can use the formula for combinations, which is C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!), where n is the total number of people and k is the number of people involved in each handshake (which is 2 in this case).

So, we have:

C(10, 2) = 10! / (2!(10-2)!)

C(10, 2) = 10! / (2! * 8!)

C(10, 2) = (10 * 9 * 8!)/(2! * 8!)

C(10, 2) = (10 * 9)/(2)

C(10, 2) = 45

There will be 45 handshakes at the party.
